sen.j: 徳姫（とくひめ、1559年11月11日（永禄2年10月12日 (旧暦)） - 1636年2月16日（寛永13年1月10日 (旧暦)））は、織田信長の長女。
sen.e: Tokuhime (November 11, 1559 - February 16, 1636) was the eldest daughter of Nobunaga ODA.
Tokuhime (November 11, 1559 - February 16, 1636) was the eldest daughter of Nobunaga ODA.
Tokuhime (November 11, 1559 - February 16, 1636) was the eldest daughter of Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 生母は生駒吉乃といわれているが、『織田家雑録』には信忠の姉となっているなど、生母が生駒吉乃であることに矛盾を示唆する史料もある。
sen.e: It is believed that her real mother was Kitsuno IKOMA, but some historical materials show an implication of misidentification as "Odake Zatsuroku" (Oda Family's Miscellaneous Records) says that she was an older sister of Nobutada.

It is believed that her real mother was Kitsuno IKOMA, but some historical materials show an implication of misidentification as it is said in "Odake Zatsuroku" (Oda Family's Miscellaneous Records) that she was an older sister of Nobutada.
sen.cmt: as it is said inを "Odake Zatsuroku"の前に追加しました。
sen.e: It is believed that her real mother was Kitsuno IKOMA, but some historical materials show an implication of misidentification as it is said in "Odake Zatsuroku" (Oda Family's Miscellaneous Records) that she was an older sister of Nobutada.

sen.j: 松平信康の正室。
sen.e: She was a lawful wife of Nobuyasu MATSUDAIRA.
She was a lawful wife of Nobuyasu MATSUDAIRA.
She was a lawful wife of Nobuyasu MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: 名は五徳、尾張御新造さま、岡崎殿とも。
sen.e: Her real name was Gotoku, and she was also called "Owari goshinzo sama" (the lady of Owari) or "Okazaki dono" (Miss or Mrs. Okazaki).
Her real name was Gotoku, and she was also called "Owari goshinzo sama" (the lady of Owari) or "Okazaki dono" (Miss or Mrs. Okazaki).
Her real name was Gotoku, and she was also called "Owari goshinzo sama" (the lady of Owari) or "Okazaki dono" (Miss or Mrs. Okazaki).

sen.j: 法名は見星院香岩桂寿大姉。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name was "Kensei-in kogan keiju daishi."
sen.cmt: 法名は音読みしました。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name was "Kensei-in kogan keiju daishi."
Her posthumous Buddhist name was "Kensei-in kogan keiju daishi."

sen.j: 永禄10年（1567年）に徳川家康の嫡男、信康に嫁ぐ。
sen.e: She married Nobuyasu TOKUGAWA, a legitimate son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, in 1567.
She married Nobuyasu TOKUGAWA, a legitimate son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, in 1567.
She married Nobuyasu TOKUGAWA, a legitimate son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, in 1567.

sen.j: 天正4年（1576年）には、登久姫を、天正5年（1577年）には熊姫を産む。
sen.e: She gave birth to Tokuhime (Princess Toku) in 1576 and Kumahime (Princess Kuma) in 1577.
She gave birth to Tokuhime (Princess Toku) in 1576 and Kumahime (Princess Kuma) in 1577.
She gave birth to Tokuhime (Princess Toku) in 1576 and Kumahime (Princess Kuma) in 1577.

sen.j: しかし、いつまでも嫡子が生まれぬのを心配した姑の築山殿が､信康に元武田氏家臣の浅原昌時の娘で、部屋子をしていた女性を側室に迎えさせたため、この時から築山殿と徳姫が不和になったといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that Tukiyama-dono, Tokuhime's mother-in-law, who worried that Tokuhime did not give birth to a legitimate child for a long time after marriage, made Nobuyasu marry a servant lady, who was a daughter of Masatoki ASAHARA, an ex-vassal of the Takeda clan, and that this lead to discord between Tukiyama-dono and Tokuhime.
sen.cmt: 浅原昌時の読み方を確認できませんでした。訓読みしています。
sen.e: It is said that since Tukiyama-dono, Tokuhime's mother-in-law, was worried that Tokuhime did not give birth to a legitimate child for a long time after marriage, she made Nobuyasu marry a female servant who was a daughter of an ex-vassal of the Takeda clan Masatoki ASAHARA, which led to discord between Tukiyama-dono and Tokuhime.
sen.cmt: 文のオーダーを変えました。
sen.e: It is said that since Tukiyama-dono, Tokuhime's mother-in-law, was worried that Tokuhime did not give birth to a legitimate child for a long time after marriage, she made Nobuyasu marry a female servant who was a daughter of an ex-vassal of the Takeda clan Masatoki ASAHARA, which led to discord between Tukiyama-dono and Tokuhime.

sen.j: が、築山殿と徳姫は居城が別であり、また側室がいることが当たり前の時代においてそのようなことで嫁姑の仲がこじれたということは考えにくい。
sen.e: Considering that Tukiyama-dono and Tokuhime stayed in different castles and that it was the time when having concubines was broadly accepted, it is hard to believe that it could be a cause of discord between a mother-in-law and her daughter-in-law.

Considering that Tukiyama-dono and Tokuhime stayed in different castles and it was the time when having concubines was broadly accepted, it is hard to believe that it became a cause of discord between a mother-in-law and her daughter-in-law.
sen.cmt: thatを省略し、 couldを becameに訂正しました。
sen.e: Considering that Tukiyama-dono and Tokuhime stayed in different castles and it was the time when having concubines was broadly accepted, it is hard to believe that it became a cause of discord between a mother-in-law and her daughter-in-law.

sen.j: しかし徳姫と信康が不仲であったことを示す史料として家臣の日記である『家忠日記』の中に、家康が信康、徳姫の不仲を仲裁するために岡崎へやって来た、と記されている。
sen.e: However, "Ietada Nikki" (the Diary of Ietada MATSUDAIRA, a vassal), which is served as a historical material proving discord between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu, says that Ieyasu came to Okazaki to mediate between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu.

However, "Ietada Nikki" (the Diary of a vassal Ietada MATSUDAIRAl), which is served as a historical material proving discord between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu, says that Ieyasu came to Okazaki to mediate between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu.
sen.cmt: a vassalの位置を変えました。
sen.e: However, "Ietada Nikki" (the Diary of a vassal Ietada MATSUDAIRAl), which is served as a historical material proving discord between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu, says that Ieyasu came to Okazaki to mediate between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu.

sen.j: その頃信長も岡崎にやってきたことも記されており、信長も娘夫婦の仲を心配してやってきた可能性も推測できる。
sen.e: The diary also says that Nobunaga, too, came to Okazaki at that time, which allows us to conjecture that Nobunaga might have been worrying the relationship between his daughter and his son-in-law.
The diary also says that Nobunaga, too, came to Okazaki at that time, which brings a speculation that Nobunaga might have been worrying the relationship between his daughter and his son-in-law.
sen.cmt: which allows us to conjectureをbrings a speculationに変えました。
sen.e: The diary also says that Nobunaga, too, came to Okazaki at that time, which brings a speculation that Nobunaga might have been worrying the relationship between his daughter and his son-in-law.

sen.j: 一時的にせよ夫婦仲がこじれたことがあったことは事実であるといえよう。
sen.e: The discord between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu should be, even if it was temporary, a historical fact.
One can say that the discord between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu was a historical fact even if it was temporary.
sen.cmt: One can say thatを文頭に加え、even if...の位置を変えました。
sen.e: One can say that the discord between Tokuhime and Nobuyasu was a historical fact even if it was temporary.

sen.j: 天正7年（1579年）に徳姫は父の信長に、築山殿と信康の罪状（武田との密通など）を訴える十二ヶ条の訴状を書き送った。
sen.e: In 1579, Tokuhime sent to her father, Nobunaga, a petition of twelve clauses that accused Tukiyama-dono and Nobuyasu of their guilty acts including a sneaky liaison with Takeda.
In 1579, Tokuhime sent her father, Nobunaga, a petition of twelve clauses that accused Tukiyama-dono and Nobuyasu of their guilty acts including a sneaky liaison with Takeda.
sen.cmt: sent to のtoを省略しました。
sen.e: In 1579, Tokuhime sent her father, Nobunaga, a petition of twelve clauses that accused Tukiyama-dono and Nobuyasu of their guilty acts including a sneaky liaison with Takeda.

sen.j: この訴状を読んだ信長は、安土城に滞在していた家康の使者である酒井忠次を通して信康の殺害を命じた。
sen.e: After reading this petition, Nobunaga gave the order to kill Nobuyasu via Tadatsugu SAKAI, Ieyasu's envoy who was staying in the Azuchi castle.
After reading this petition, Nobunaga gave the order to kill Nobuyasu via Tadatsugu SAKAI, Ieyasu's envoy who was staying in the Azuchi castle.
After reading this petition, Nobunaga gave the order to kill Nobuyasu via Tadatsugu SAKAI, Ieyasu's envoy who was staying in the Azuchi castle.

sen.j: 築山殿は8月29日 (旧暦)に小藪村で殺害され、信康は9月15日 (旧暦)に二俣城で切腹した。
sen.e: Tsukiyama-dono was killed at Koyabu Village on August 29 (lunar calendar), and Nobuyasu committed seppuku at the Futamata-jo Castle on September 15 (lunar calendar).
Tsukiyama-dono was killed at Koyabu Village on September 19, and Nobuyasu committed seppuku at the Futamata-jo Castle on October 5.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦に変えました。
sen.e: Tsukiyama-dono was killed at Koyabu Village on September 19, and Nobuyasu committed seppuku at the Futamata-jo Castle on October 5.

sen.j: しかし、この「信長の十二ヶ条」は、後に加筆・修正された可能性があるとも言われている。
sen.e: This 'Twelve Clauses of Nobunaga' is said to have a possibility of touching up and correction by posterity.
This 'Twelve Clauses of Nobunaga' is said to hold a possibility of being revised and edited later.
sen.cmt: have a possibility of touching up and correction by posterity をhold a possibility of being revised and edited laterに訂正しました。
sen.e: This 'Twelve Clauses of Nobunaga' is said to hold a possibility of being revised and edited later.

sen.j: 事件の発端となったはずの徳姫自身が信康弁明の為に安土に居る信長に会いに行くと家康に頼み込んだりするなど（山岡荘八著徳川家康 (山岡荘八)による説）、信康切腹事件に関しては不可解な点が多く、近年では家康と信康の対立が原因との説も出されている。
sen.e: A novel depicting a scene in which Tokuhime, the source of accusation, begs Ieyasu for a permission to go to see Nobunaga in the Azuchi Castle for the sake of Nobuyasu's defense ("Ieyasu Tokugawa" by Sohachi YAMAOKA), there are many unclear points left about Nobuyasu's seppuku, and in recent years there is a theory that the originating discord existed between Ieyasu and Nobuyasu.

This Nobuyasu's incident has many unclear points including Tokuhime, who is believed to be the source of accusation, begging Ieyasu for a permission to go to see Nobunaga in the Azuchi Castle for the sake of Nobuyasu's defense (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA theory by Sohachi YAMAOKA), and in recent years there is a theory which suggests the discord between Ieyasu and Nobuyasu to be the cause.
sen.cmt: 全体の文を訂正しました。
sen.e: This Nobuyasu's incident has many unclear points including Tokuhime, who is believed to be the source of accusation, begging Ieyasu for a permission to go to see Nobunaga in the Azuchi Castle for the sake of Nobuyasu's defense (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA theory by Sohachi YAMAOKA), and in recent years there is a theory which suggests the discord between Ieyasu and Nobuyasu to be the cause.

sen.j: その後、徳姫は天正8年（1580年）の2月20日 (旧暦)に家康に見送られ岡崎城を出立し、美濃国に帰った。
sen.e: After that, Tokuhime departed from the Okazaki Castle on February 20, 1580 (lunar calendar), with Ieyasu's send-off, and returned to Mino Province.
After that, Tokuhime departed from the Okazaki Castle on February 20, 1580 (lunar calendar), with Ieyasu's send-off, and returned to Mino Province.
After that, Tokuhime departed from the Okazaki Castle on February 20, 1580 (lunar calendar), with Ieyasu's send-off, and returned to Mino Province.

sen.j: 2人の娘達は家康の元に残していった。
sen.e: She left her two daughters to Ieyasu.
She left her two daughters to Ieyasu.
She left her two daughters to Ieyasu.

sen.j: しかし、父の信長の元には向かわず、兄の織田信忠の元に身を寄せた。
sen.e: However, she did not head for her father, Nobunaga, but she lived under the roof of her older brother, Nobutada ODA.
However, she did not head for her father, Nobunaga, but she lived under the roof of her older brother, Nobutada ODA.
However, she did not head for her father, Nobunaga, but she lived under the roof of her older brother, Nobutada ODA.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）に起きた本能寺の変では、父・長兄ともに失ってしまったため、次兄の織田信雄に保護された。
sen.e: Since she lost her father and oldest brother in the Honnoji Incident in 1582, she lived under the protection of her second eldest brother, Nobukatsu ODA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since she lost her father and oldest brother in the Honnoji Incident in 1582, she lived under the protection of her second eldest brother, Nobukatsu ODA.
Since she lost her father and oldest brother in the Honnoji Incident in 1582, she lived under the protection of her second eldest brother, Nobukatsu ODA.

sen.j: しかし、小牧の役後に信雄と秀吉の講和に際して人質として京都に居を構えた。
sen.e: Facing the reconciliation between Nobukatsu and Hideyoshi after the Battle of Komaki, she had to move to Kyoto for being a hostage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Facing the reconciliation between Nobukatsu and Hideyoshi after the Battle of Komaki, she had to move to Kyoto as a hostage
sen.cmt: for being a hostage をas a hostageに訂正しました。
sen.e: Facing the reconciliation between Nobukatsu and Hideyoshi after the Battle of Komaki, she had to move to Kyoto as a hostage

sen.j: しかし、天正18年（1590年）には信雄が豊臣秀吉によって改易されたため、生駒氏の尾張国の小折に移り住んだが、これは「埴原家文書」に残された秀吉の朱印状から秀吉による処置だったことが明らかで、その後すぐにまた京都に居住するなど、五徳の処遇は秀吉の支配下にあったことが推測できる。
sen.e: In 1590, Nobukatsu was deprived of his post by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, so she transferred to Koori in Owari Province dominated by the Ikoma clan, and this was evidently instructed by Hideyushi, judging from the Shuinjo (a shogunal license for foreign trade) of Hideyoshi existing in "Haibara-ke Monjo" (Haibara Family's Written Material), and from the fact that soon she lived back in Kyoto, it seems that Gotoku's treatment was under the control of Hideyoshi.

In 1590, Nobukatsu was deprived of his post by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, so she transferred to Koori in Owari Province dominated by the Ikoma clan, and this was evidently instructed by Hideyushi judging from the Shuinjo (a shogunal license for foreign trade) of Hideyoshi existing in "Haibara-ke Monjo" (Haibara Family's Written Material) as well as the fact that soon she lived back in Kyoto, and it seems that Gotoku's treatment was under the control of Hideyoshi.
sen.cmt: it seems の前にandを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1590, Nobukatsu was deprived of his post by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, so she transferred to Koori in Owari Province dominated by the Ikoma clan, and this was evidently instructed by Hideyushi judging from the Shuinjo (a shogunal license for foreign trade) of Hideyoshi existing in "Haibara-ke Monjo" (Haibara Family's Written Material) as well as the fact that soon she lived back in Kyoto, and it seems that Gotoku's treatment was under the control of Hideyoshi.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦い後は、尾張国の清洲城主となった家康の4男の松平忠吉から1761石の所領を与えられた。
sen.e: After the Battle of Sekigahara, she was given 1,761 koku of territory from Tadayoshi MATSUDAIRA, the fourth son of Ieyasu ruling Owari Province from the Kiyosu Castle.
After the Battle of Sekigahara, she was given 1,761 koku of territory from the fourth son of Ieyasu, Tadayoshi MATSUDAIRA who became the head of Kishu Castle in Owari Province.
sen.cmt: the fourth son of Ieyasu ruling Owari Province from the Kiyosu Castle を the fourth son of Ieyasu, Tadayoshi MATSUDAIRA who became the head of Kishu Castle in Owari Provinceに訂正しました。
sen.e: After the Battle of Sekigahara, she was given 1,761 koku of territory from the fourth son of Ieyasu, Tadayoshi MATSUDAIRA who became the head of Kishu Castle in Owari Province.

sen.j: その後は京都に隠棲した。
sen.e: Later on, she lived in seclusion in Kyoto.
Later on, she lived in seclusion in Kyoto.
Later on, she lived in seclusion in Kyoto.

sen.j: 寛永7年（1630年）蜂須賀忠英と正室繁姫（小笠原忠脩の娘で徳姫の曾孫）の間に、嫡子千松丸（蜂須賀光隆）が誕生した際には、乳母の選定について相談されている。
sen.e: In 1630, when Senmatsumaru, or Mitsutaka HACHISUKA, a legitimate child between Tadateru HACHISUKA and his lawful wife, Shigehime, a great-grandchild of Tokuhime and also a daughter of Tadanaga OGASAWARA, was born, she was consulted on the choice of wet nurses.
sen.cmt: 繁姫の読みを確認できませんでした。しげひめと読んでいます。
sen.e: In 1630, when Senmatsumaru (also known as Mitsutaka HACHISUKA), a legitimate child between Tadateru HACHISUKA and his lawful wife, Shigehime (a great-grandchild of Tokuhime and also a daughter of Tadanaga OGASAWARA) was born, she was consulted on the choice of wet nurses.
sen.cmt: 原文のように括弧の中に書く個人の説明を表記しました。
sen.e: In 1630, when Senmatsumaru (also known as Mitsutaka HACHISUKA), a legitimate child between Tadateru HACHISUKA and his lawful wife, Shigehime (a great-grandchild of Tokuhime and also a daughter of Tadanaga OGASAWARA) was born, she was consulted on the choice of wet nurses.

sen.j: 寛永13年（1636年）に死去した。
sen.e: She died in 1636.
She died in 1636.
She died in 1636.

sen.j: 長女の登久姫は小笠原秀政の妻に、2女の熊姫は本多忠政の妻になった。
sen.e: Tokuhime, her eldest daughter, became a wife of Hidemasa OGASAWARA, and Kumahime, her second daughter, became a wife of Tadamasa HONDA.
Tokuhime, her eldest daughter, became a wife of Hidemasa OGASAWARA, and Kumahime, her second daughter, became a wife of Tadamasa HONDA.
Tokuhime, her eldest daughter, became a wife of Hidemasa OGASAWARA, and Kumahime, her second daughter, became a wife of Tadamasa HONDA.
